title: 2017-05-16 - 2017-05-16 - MORE EXAMPLES OF MALSPAM PUSHING JAFF RANSOMWARE

NOTES:

More malspam pushing Jaff ransomware today...
It's the same type of malspam we've seen before with PDF attachments --> embedded
Word documents (with malicious macros) --> follow-up malware.
Below are the blogs I've personally posted about it here at malware-traffic-analysis.net:

2017-04-19 - Dridex malspam with PDF attachments containing embedded Word
docs
[2017-04-21 - Dridex-style malspam pushes Locky ransomware instead](http://malware-traffic-analysis.net/2017/04/21/index3.html)
2017-05-11 - [Jumping on the Jaff bandwagon](http://malware-traffic-analysis.net/2017/05/11/index3.html)
[2017-05-15 - The Jaff ransomware train keeps on rollin'](http://malware-traffic-analysis.net/2017/05/15/index.html)
2017-05-16 - More examples of malspam pushing Jaff ransomware (this blog
post)


-----

## MALWARE

_Shown above: As usual, the PDF attachment contains an embedded Word document with_
_malicious macros._

JAFF RANSOMWARE SAMPLE:

SHA256 hash:
387812ee2820cbf49812b1b229b7d8721ee37296f7b6018332a56e30a99e1092
File size: 147,456 bytes
File location: C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Local\Temp\galaperidol8.exe

## TRAFFIC

194.58.119.16 port 80 - jsplast.ru - GET /Nbiyure3
